meanings.definition: provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate some action or reaction
meanings.sent1: The teacher kept goading the students to participate in the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: His constant teasing was goading his little sister to retaliate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was goading the dog by stealing its treats.
meanings.sent4: Her persistent nagging acted as a goading force for him to finally clean his room.
meanings.sent5: The coach's motivational speech was a powerful goading influence on the team.

meanings.definition: a stick with a pointed or electrically charged end, for driving cattle or oxen
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a goading to guide the cattle towards the barn.
meanings.sent2: The sharp tip of the goading helped in herding the stubborn oxen.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended a stick was a goading and played cowboy.
meanings.sent4: The goading in the farmer's hand was a symbol of his authority over the livestock.
meanings.sent5: The old goading had seen many long days of herding cattle in the fields.
